Text: Sunday Weather Update Hi Everyone The forecast pattern seems very similar to what weve been talking about over the past several days features below normal in the Midwest and the East with a brief normalization possible toward the Great Lakes next weekend days and before more cool air arrives indicates yet another trough digging into the East temperatures normal to below normal with the primary ridge remaining in the Southwest above to much above Day forecast also looks similar still quite cool for the East and Midwest though not quite as hot for the immediate West Coast Above to much above normal temperatures will be common across interior California for most of the week with a to day spike of warm temperatures near the coast midweek No prolonged period of heat will affect the Northwest EarthSat will issue an official and forecast around pm today You can get this map by going to miscenron and then follow the Sunday Update link near the bottom Login is enron Password is enron Maps are attached this is the way we feel things will look to start the day tomorrow If there are any changes to this picture it may be to warm the Midwest East closer to normal Right now this solution appears unlikely but if there are any surprises tomorrow it may be a SLIGHTLY warmer picture for the East Enjoy the rest of your weekend Research Weather Team

Chicago OHare Cc Lpst Per Your Request Average Monthly Temperature Basis Normal May May From a demand standpoint May Heating Demand There were days with a minimum temperature below days below and no days with a minimum below There was day with a maximum temperature below May th featured a maximum temperature of degrees The lowest maximum temperature was degrees on the th and the lowest minimum temperature was set on the th There were no periods during the month where the minimum temperature dropped below degrees for or more consecutive days May Cooling Demand There were days with a maximum temperature or higher days reached maximum temperature or higher The warmest maximum temperature was degrees on May th There was one stretch of consecutive days where temperatures were or higher May and May Heating Demand There were days with a minimum temperature below days below and days below The lowest minimum temperature in the month was on the th and lowest maximum temperature was on the th and the th There were two stretches of or more consecutive days with minimum temperatures below May and May May Cooling Demand There were days with a maximum temperature of or higher days reached a maximum temperature of or higher The warmest maximum temperature was on the th There were two stretches of or more consecutive with maximums or higher May and May May each featured temperatures of or warmer Comment I think that May of should have prompted more overall demand than May of based on the more extreme nature of heat and cool June June To Date Forecast for the month to From a demand standpoint June of Heating Demand There were days with a minimum temperature below and no days below The lowest minimum temperature was on June One period during the month featured or more days with a minimum temperature below June and June of Cooling Demand There were days with maximum temperatures or higher days reached or higher No days over The warmest maximum temperature was on June There was one stretch with or more consecutive days over June This stretch also featured consecutive days over June of Heating Demand To date There have been days with a minimum temperature below and no days below June and were consecutively below for minimum temperatures Forecast The forecast through June is likely to bring at least and as many as more days with minimum temperatures below June of Cooling Demand To date No days or higher Forecast June through will likely bring fewer than days with a maximum temperature over and or fewer days over No days are expected to top before June No stretches of or more consecutive days over are expected before the th Long range forecasts would indicate that it is unlikely that any significant stretches of heat will impact Chicago through the end of June Comment With below to much below normal temperatures continuing for much of June cooling load will be less than June of Im not sure exactly how much the increased heating load will offset the total monthly demand Let me know if I can help more Steve Stephen Bennett Senior Meteorologist Enron Research Ext

Weather Transition Complete For My Part Cc PST Hi Guys Per our discussion this morning two further items needed to complete my end of this transition of the weather team A contact number for The Weather Channel Its a switchboard number but they do have a dial by name directory thats how I get anybody I know there The names Dr Steve Lyons and Kevin Stenson My internet explorer bookmarks can be found at OResearchBennettFavorites My understanding is that this is all you guys need from me to complete my part of this transition Please confirm this and let me know ifwhat you still need me to do To avoid confusion please respond to everyone on the list above so that we can ensure that HR continues to be in the loop with this effort Sorry about the confusion but please let me know what further I can do or if you are satisfied please confirm that there is nothing further that you need Steve Stephen Bennett Meteorology Manager Enron Research

RE Lizette Palmer Employment Attorney Cc PST Hi Anne Ive been told by Hunter Shively and David Oxley that my commitment to transitioning this organization will end when the deal closes late this week As such I have met again with Hunter and Jay to make sure that my part of this transition is complete I am tying up some loose ends today and hopefully these guys will have everything they need from me by this afternoon David told me that as long as these guys are satisfied then Im clear to go back to the estate with my job over here complete With this new information I do not believe that I need to meet with the employment attorney at this time Thank you for your help I will update you once things are complete over here Steve Stephen Bennett Meteorology Manager Enron Research Original Message From Labbe Anne Sent Tuesday February AM To Roberts Mike A Bennett Stephen Subject Lizette Palmer Employment Attorney Hey guys Lizette Palmer our employment attorney would be more than happy to meet with you at in A old building if you would still like some reassurance that your transition help will not create a conflict of interest Also I am on in the new building now so if you need anything please just let me know Thanks Anne

Dr Steve Lyons Summary of Hurricane Season Forwarded by Stephen BennettNAEnron on AM on AM To cc Subject Summary of Hurricane Season Steve Lyons To Met Department OCM Department Production Department Radio LatinMet WC News Center Weathercom Atlanta PM cc Subject Summary of Hurricane Season Steve Lyons Tropical Program Manager The Weather Channel For your information I have attached a TWC summary of hurricane season This summary was written with help from John Hope and Stu Ostro If you have any questions please contact me Thanks Steve See attached file Summary of Hurricane Season doc Summary of Hurricane Season doc

TWC Newsis a section from an internal TWC memorandum it looks like Q might make up for the quiet tropical season as far as their profits are concerned WEATHER CHANNEL EARNS HIGHEST RATINGS FOR ANY DECEMBER IN ITS HISTORY Coverage of last months Winter Blitz brought The Weather Channel the highest ratings for any December in its year history and shattered weathercoms previous December page view records December was the third highestrated month ever The Blizzard of gave TWC its highest ratings followed by Hurricane Floyd in September Among the many recordingbreaking weather events reported by TWC last month were the snowiest weather ever in at least cities and the coldest weather on record in many places including Louisville Ky Decembers winter weather events coupled with early wintry weather in October and November boosted the network to an alltime high th quarter rating despite comparatively lower averages early in the quarter due to quieter than usual hurricane activity TWCs coverage of the yearend Noreaster that blanketed New York City with over a foot of snow achieved a rating delivering households across the country on Saturday December am am The top quarter hour occurred at am with a rating of reaching million households The weekend rating for Dec was representing over a half million households tuned in at any given time according to Nielsen data This was the second highestrated weekend in and the sixth highestrated weekend in TWCs history Consumers also turned to weathercom in record numbers By the close of December weathercom delivered more than million total page views which is percent higher than the previous monthly record and percent higher than December At its peak weathercom delivered a record million page views in a single day More than million Unique Visitors frequented weathercom per day during the two weeks prior to Christmas according to Media Metrix The average TWC rating am am from Dec was delivering an average of households according to Nielsen This was percent higher than the average rating for the same twoweek period the year before The Weather Channels coverage of sustained winter activity which included a Chicago blizzard on Dec brought the network its highestrated December ever TWC achieved a December rating of am am delivering an average of households Steve
